author: bridge-bot
content:
<amezianehamlat> re: **@marcin_d_s**
> According to current benchmarks (https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/d/feo4ronhsqv40d/opcodes-benchmarking) with fixed number of instructions (and without precompiles), these are operations performing below 100MGas/s. 

I excluded cases where Besu was the only underperforming client, it was just too often and we likely need to improve the process.

Keccak in underperforming in all clients so I propose 2x repricing, in all other cases there is at least one client performing above 100MGas/s, so it is theoretically possible to improve without repricing.

Just FYI, there is already an EIP for tripling price of Point Evaluation precompile (https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/10864) and likely we will need to reprice also EcRecover, but we need to wait for accurate benchmark data for that.
Hi @marcin_d_s ðŸ‘‹,
We would like to reproduce the numbers, what are the fixtures or inputs you were using to get the numbers ? is fixtures release benchmark v0.0.6 ?
Could you share the fixtures version you used when sharing opcode performance numbers ?

Hi @amezianehamlat ! I used a data from https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/d/feo4ronhsqv40d/opcodes-benchmarking
Under the hood it uses test cases with fixed opcode counts. There will be a new iteration of these, most likely tomorrow.
